Description: Head of terracotta figure of Dionysos. A head, broken perhaps from a figure of Dionysos. It is full-bearded and wears a large tightly woven wreath with a horizontal fillet tied at each side. The back is plain. Hollow; two-piece mould. Light-brown clay with a little mica, fired to a buff to red colour on the surface; possibly a mixture of a Nile silt and a marl clay. There are traces of a white dressing on the front, with pink paint on the wreath and a line of black paint behind the ridge of the wreath on top of the head.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3338)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
